verbose_text: XREF_BIBR In vitro, both hydrated C3 [C3 (H 2 O)] (designated in this paper as " C3 ") and C3b (C3 after cleavage of the small peptide, C3a) are active forms of C3 that share domains enabling them to attach to surfaces and initiate activation of the AP.
evidence: C3b (C3 after cleavage of the small peptide, C3a) are active forms of C3 that share domains enabling them to attach to surfaces and initiate activation of the AP
